# Data validation notebook  

Run this notebook to run various tests comparing MiPINS and ODW tables.
#### Imports etc

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
import pyspark.sql.functions as f
import pprint
import json
from tqdm import tqdm
import requests as r
import inspect
import pandas as pd

# NB: DataFrame.iteritems is deprecated from 1.5 upwards. Use .items instead. 
# spark.createDataFrame uses iteritems which won't work so temporarily hardcoding this switch to get around this.
# Better package management is needed longer term
pd.DataFrame.iteritems = pd.DataFrame.items

#### Run data_validation_utils notebook to reference all functions and variables from there  

This keeps this notebook a lot smaller and tidier and just contains the bare minimum code
%run utils/data-validation/py_utils_data_validation_functions

test_function_list = [
    test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target,
    test1_export_values,
    test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source,
    test2_export_values,
    test3_count_source_table_rows,
    test4_count_target_table_rows,
    test5_count_source_table_columns,
    test6_count_target_table_columns,
    test7_duplicates_in_odw,
    test8_source_target_shape_match,
    test9_values_mismatch
    # test10_count_values_mismatch,
    # test11_values_match_percentage
]

test_list = [
    "test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target",
    "test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source",
    "test3_count_source_table_rows",
    "test4_count_target_table_rows",
    "test5_count_source_table_columns",
    "test6_count_target_table_columns",
    "test7_duplicates_in_odw",
    "test8_source_target_shape_match",
    "test9_values_mismatch"
    # "test10_count_values_mismatch",
    # "test11_values_match_percentage"

#### Print lists of all callables and / or functions available in the current context.  

This might be useful to see in one place here rather than switching between notebooks looking for the function names etc

# print a list of everything that is callable within the current context (variables, functions, imports etc)
# print("List of callables...")
# callables = [f for f in dir() if f[0] != '_']
# callables.sort()
# pprint.pprint(callables)
# print("*********************************")
# print("*********************************")
# print a list of functions available in the current context
function_list = ([f.__name__ for f in globals().values() if type(f) == type(lambda *args: None)])
# list of functions that I'm not interested in (maybe built-in notebook functions?)
unwanted = ["trap_exit", "initializeLHContext", "display"]
for i in unwanted:
    function_list.remove(i)
function_list.sort()
# print("List of functions...")
# pprint.pprint(function_list)
#### Print the test functions and their required arguments

for test in test_function_list:
    func_args = inspect.getfullargspec(test).args
    print(f'{test.__name__} -> {func_args}')
    # print(type(func_args))
#### Print the table mappings
pprint.pprint(table_mapping)
#### Print the table keys
pprint.pprint(table_keys)
#### Loop through tables and run each test against each table

for source, target in tqdm(table_mapping.items()):
    source_dbtable = source
    target_dbtable = target
    test_source_df = sourcedataset(source_dbtable)
    test_target_df = targetdataset(target_database, target_dbtable)
    
    # run test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target
    result = test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target(test_source_df, test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target'] = result

    # run test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source
    result = test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source(test_source_df, test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source'] = result

    # run test3_count_source_table_rows
    result = test3_count_source_table_rows(test_source_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test3_count_source_table_rows'] = result

    # run test4_count_target_table_rows
    result = test4_count_target_table_rows(test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test4_count_target_table_rows'] = result

    # run test5_count_source_table_columns
    result = test5_count_source_table_columns(test_source_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test5_count_source_table_columns'] = result

    # run test6_count_target_table_columns
    result = test6_count_target_table_columns(test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test6_count_target_table_columns'] = result

    # run test7_duplicates_in_odw
    result = test7_duplicates_in_odw(test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test7_duplicates_in_odw'] = result

    # run test8_source_target_shape_match
    result = test8_source_target_shape_match(test_source_df, test_target_df)
    test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test8_source_target_shape_match'] = result

print("All tests complete!")
#### Show test results in a DataFrame

result_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(test_results_dict, orient="index")
result_df.index.name = "Source Table"
result_df
#### Write mismatched records to a csv file and send to storage account

# loop through test results and set the source and target DataFrames
for source, target in tqdm(test_results_dict.items()):
    source_dbtable = source
    target_dbtable = target['target_table']
    test_source_df = sourcedataset(source_dbtable)
    test_target_df = targetdataset(target_database, target_dbtable)

    # if certain tests are True then the records need exporting to csv and saved in storage
    if target['test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target'] == True:
        test = test1_export_values
        folder = 'test1_rows_in_source_not_in_target'
        write_records_to_csv(test, folder)
        print("test1 records saved to storage")
    elif target['test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source'] == True:
        test = test2_export_values
        folder = 'test2_rows_in_target_not_in_source'
        write_records_to_csv(test, folder)
        print("test2 records saved to storage")
    else:
        print(f'Table {source}: No records saved to storage')

print("Test 1 and test 2 output files written to storage")

#### Compare source and target tables and save results to storage.  

1. Check if DataFrames have the same number of columns.  
2. Run test9_values_mismatch and save result to test_results_dict.  
3. Save comparison results to storage as csv file.

for source, target in tqdm(test_results_dict.items()):
    for table, key in table_keys.items():
        if table == source:
            table_key = key
            source_dbtable = source
            target_dbtable = target['target_table']
            test_source_df = sourcedataset(source_dbtable)
            test_target_df = targetdataset(target_database, target_dbtable)
            print(f'Creating df_compare for table {source_dbtable}')
            print("****************************************")
            print("****************************************")
            # check if dataframes have the same number of columns
            if test5_count_source_table_columns(test_source_df) == test6_count_target_table_columns(test_target_df):
                df_compare = create_dataframes_to_compare(test_source_df, test_target_df, table_key)
                print("Running test9_values_mismatch against df_compare...")
                result = test9_values_mismatch(df_compare)
                print(f'Values mismatch: {result}')
                print("Updating test_results_dict with test9_values_mismatch result...")
                test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
                test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test9_values_mismatch'] = result
                # save to results to storage
                print("Writing the output to storage...")
                df_compare_csv = df_compare.to_csv(header=True, index=True)
                df_compare_path = f'{mount_path}/outputs/comparison_records'
                df_compare_filename = f'{source_dbtable}.csv'
                write_file_to_storage(
                    path=df_compare_path,
                    filename=df_compare_filename,
                    data=df_compare_csv
                    )
                print("****************************************")
                print("****************************************")
            else:
                print("Column mismatch - cannot compare")
                result = "Column mismatch"
                test_results_dict[source_dbtable]['test9_values_mismatch'] = result
                print("****************************************")
                print("****************************************")
#### Show updated test results table

result_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(test_results_dict, orient="index")
result_df.index.name = "Source Table"
result_df
#### Write test results file to storage account

test_results_csv = result_df.to_csv(header=True, index=True)

write_file_to_storage(
    path = f'{mount_path}{test_results_relative_path}',
    filename = test_results_file_name,
    data = test_results_csv

#### Set the exit value of the notebook  

This can be anything - dictionary, list, single value. 

This could be used in a pipeline if needed.
# mssparkutils.notebook.exit(test_results_dict)
